description: {"blocks":[{"key":"dla8s","text":"Solid human tissue is homogenized, protein is extracted, and samples prefractionated and desalted. Protein samples are ready for top-down proteomics.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"514q0","text":"RIPA lysis buffer (50 mM Tris, 150 mM NaCl, 1% NP-40 (v/v), 0.5% sodium deoxycholate (w/v), 0.1% sodium dodecyl sulfate (w/v), pH 7.4, 1X Halt Protease and Phosphotase Inhibitor Cocktail (Thermo Scientific))","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cgour","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"12aot","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1fn6r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ec0g1","text":"10% GELFrEE cartridge","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6hsdv","text":"Acetone (stored in -20C freezer)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"11qf","text":"Sodium dodecyl sulfate","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7n48r","text":"LCMS -grade methanol (Fisher Scientific #A456-4)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aq6l7","text":"LCMS-grade water (Fisher Scientific #W64)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1d9gm","text":"LCMS-grade acetonitrile (Fisher Scientific #A955-4)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a09ei","text":"HPLC-grade chloroform","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6vsfa","text":"LCMS-grade formic acid (Thermo Scientific #28905)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"et4m5","text":"LCMS-grade acetic acid","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":46819,"mol_weight":0,"name":"HALT steps.section: Cell lysis, protein precipitation, and lysate quantitation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2flu7","text":"Cryopulverize tissue sample with Retsch Cryomill","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dosfb","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"77tb6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"equipment","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":3119,"brand":"Retsch","can_edit":0,"guid":"958BF34098F111ECAE52ABFCAF4CDDC0","link":"https://www.retsch.com/products/milling/ball-mills/mixer-mill-cryomill/function-features/","name":"Cryomill","sku":"20.749.0001","specifications":null,"type":"Cryogrinder","vendor":{"id":1393,"name":"Retsch","link":"https://www.retsch.com/products/milling/ball-mills/mixer-mill-mm-400/function-features/","image":{"source":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png","placeholder":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png"}},"file":null,"image":null}}}}

steps.section: Protein fractionation by GELFrEE
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3i0st","text":"Transfer the calculated volume containing 300 µg of protein to a new 1.5-mL Protein LoBind tube. The leftover lysates in 1% (wt/vol) SDS can be stored for several months at −80 °C. From this point on, keep the sample tubes on ice until immediately before GELFrEE. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":97,"length":82},{"style":"italic","offset":181,"length":81}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Protein fractionation by GELFrEE
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9kvp1","text":"Calculate 300 ug protein","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Protein fractionation by GELFrEE
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"76cmm","text":"Add 8 µL of 1 M DTT, 30 µL of GELFrEE sample loading buffer, and dH2O to a final volume of 150 µL.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Protein fractionation by GELFrEE
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ba0vv","text":"Vortex each tube for 10–20 s, and heat it at 95 °C for 5 min. Centrifuge the samples at 1,000g for 2 min at 4 °C to re-collect any condensation at the tube lids after heating","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Protein fractionation by GELFrEE
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fqoj0","text":"Perform fractionation by GELFrEE by following the manufacturer’s protocol for 10% cartridges. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2tp9i","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"atkor","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"equipment","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":3124,"brand":"Protein Discovery","can_edit":0,"guid":"A55FAB9098F611ECAE52ABFCAF4CDDC0","link":null,"name":"GELFrEE 8100 Fractionation System","sku":"42001","specifications":null,"type":"Fractionator","vendor":{"id":950,"name":"Expedeon","link":"","image":{"source":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png","placeholder":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png"}},"file":null,"image":null}}}}

steps.section: Protein fractionation by GELFrEE
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"486kl","text":"After fractions 1-5 of each sample has been collected into a new, 1.5-mL Protein LoBind tube, the fracationation process can end or more fractions can be collected, depending on the experiment.This is a natural stopping point in the protocol, as GELFrEE fractions are stable for several months at −80 °C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":193,"length":111}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Quality control of GELFrEE fraction by SDS–PAGE with silver staining
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fgcfr","text":"Mix 5–10 µL of each fraction of interest with the appropriate amount of Laemmli sample buffer for the gel lane capacity in a new microcentrifuge tube. Boil these gel samples at 95 °C for 5 min and spin down (5,000g, 20–25 °C, 30–60 s). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Cell lysis, protein precipitation, and lysate quantitation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8nck1","text":"Transfer pulverized tissue to a 15 mL conical tube and resuspend in 2 mL of cold RIPA cell lysis buffer (including 1x HALT protease/phosphatase inhibitor cocktail).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Cell lysis, protein precipitation, and lysate quantitation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"a1des","text":"Transfer two 200 uL aliquots from each sample lysate to fresh 1.5mL Lo-bind Eppendorf tubes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"54tu2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d481b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Cell lysis, protein precipitation, and lysate quantitation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"28r8g","text":"Add 6 volumes of ice-cold acetone to the lysates, vortex at high speed (setting 8) for 10–20 s, and place the tubes in a −80 °C freezer for at least 30 min to precipitate the proteins. The protein precipitate is stable in acetone overnight. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":185,"length":54}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4oqnc","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"v5e4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"equipment","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":3123,"brand":"Fisherbrand","can_edit":0,"guid":"D9DA25B098F311ECAE52ABFCAF4CDDC0","link":"https://www.fishersci.com/shop/products/fisher-scientific-analog-vortex-mixer-4/02215365?searchHijack=true\u0026searchTerm=02215365\u0026searchType=RAPID\u0026matchedCatNo=02215365","name":"Analog Vortex Mixer","sku":"02-215-365","specifications":null,"type":"Vortex mixer","vendor":{"id":31,"name":"Fisher Scientific","link":"https://www.fishersci.com/us/en/home.html","image":{"source":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png","placeholder":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png"}},"file":null,"image":null}}}}

steps.section: Cell lysis, protein precipitation, and lysate quantitation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ej8he","text":"Remove the tubes from the freezer and immediately centrifuge    ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":61,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6uie1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"21000","duration":1800,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"F485D85098F311ECAE52ABFCAF4CDDC0","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"4","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}}}}

steps.section: Cell lysis, protein precipitation, and lysate quantitation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4j8nr","text":"Remove as much acetone as possible from the protein pellets without disturbing them. Place tubes in a biological safety cabinet for 5–10 min to evaporate off any excess acetone.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Cell lysis, protein precipitation, and lysate quantitation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1pfgp","text":"Resuspend the protein pellet in 500 µL of 1% (wt/vol) SDS solution with pipetting and probe sonication It may take multiple rounds of vigorous pipetting to completely dissolve the precipitates. Lysates my also be stored at -80C until further processing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":103,"length":150}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Cell lysis, protein precipitation, and lysate quantitation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"dh5o4","text":"Transfer 25 µL of the solution to a new 1.5-mL Protein LoBind tube for the BCA assay. The tubes containing the remaining 200 µL of resuspended proteins should be kept on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Cell lysis, protein precipitation, and lysate quantitation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4b2l9","text":"A BCA assay should now be performed on the 25-µL aliquots of sample proteome, using a 96-well plate and following the manufacturer’s recommended protocol. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Cell lysis, protein precipitation, and lysate quantitation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"590mm","text":"After collection of colorimetric data for BCA assay on a 96-well-plate reader, create a standard curve, and fit the average of the triplicate values for each sample dilution to the standard curve to determine the protein concentration of each sample, after correcting for dilutions.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Quality control of GELFrEE fraction by SDS–PAGE with silver staining
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"686m9","text":"Separate the proteins in each fraction by MW using SDS–PAGE, being careful not to run lower-MW proteins off the gel that may be of interest for TDMS or TDP characterization. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Quality control of GELFrEE fraction by SDS–PAGE with silver staining
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"dham2","text":"Remove the gel and submerge it in fixing solution in a clean container. Place on an orbital shaker for 20 min at low speed to fix the gel","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Quality control of GELFrEE fraction by SDS–PAGE with silver staining
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"dqid7","text":"Replace the fixing solution with enough washing solution to submerge the gel. Shake for 10 min at RT. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Quality control of GELFrEE fraction by SDS–PAGE with silver staining
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"dg6qc","text":"Replace the washing solution with sensitizing solution. Shake for 1 min at low speed to sensitize the gel. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Quality control of GELFrEE fraction by SDS–PAGE with silver staining
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"dk5sl","text":"Pour out the sensitizing solution and rinse the gel with two washes of dH2O for 1 min each. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Quality control of GELFrEE fraction by SDS–PAGE with silver staining
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"csob3","text":"Add enough silver nitrate solution to submerge the gel and incubate it for 20 min on an orbital shaker at low speed to stain the gel. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Quality control of GELFrEE fraction by SDS–PAGE with silver staining
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"d5jmh","text":"Pour out the silver nitrate solution and rinse the gel twice in dH2O for 1 min. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Quality control of GELFrEE fraction by SDS–PAGE with silver staining
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bf0uh","text":"Add enough developing solution to submerge the gel, and develop under rapid shaking. Discard the developing solution and replace it with fresh developing solution, once the liquid turns yellow, to reduce background staining.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":85,"length":139}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Desalting and concentrating GELFrEE fractions
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"dur77","text":"To each fraction, add 4 volumes of Optima-grade methanol (600 µL), and vortex each tube vigorously for 20 s.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":107,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Quality control of GELFrEE fraction by SDS–PAGE with silver staining
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"a7508","text":"Pour out the developing solution and replace with terminating solution, once the desired staining intensity has been achieved, to terminate the development . The gel can now be scanned or photographed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Desalting and concentrating GELFrEE fractions
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"90uat","text":"Add 1 volume (150 µL) of chloroform to each fraction, and vortex vigorously for 20 s. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Desalting and concentrating GELFrEE fractions
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1ab9b","text":"Add 3 volumes (450 µL) of LC–MS-grade water to each fraction. The liquid should immediately become cloudy and white in color. Vortex vigorously for 20 s","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Desalting and concentrating GELFrEE fractions
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"dl69j","text":"Centrifuge the tubes at 21,000g for 10 min at 4 °C. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Desalting and concentrating GELFrEE fractions
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6gvrt","text":"Carefully remove the tubes from the centrifuge. The separated aqueous and organic phases should be clearly observed, with a visible white protein pellet floating at the interface. Be very careful when transporting tubes to avoid shaking them or otherwise disturbing the protein pellet more than is necessary.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":178,"length":129}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Desalting and concentrating GELFrEE fractions
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"a8i6f","text":"Remove and discard the top layer of solution, using extreme care to not remove or disturb the protein pellet. It may be necessary to leave a few millimeters of volume above the pellet to avoid accidentally pipetting it out. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Desalting and concentrating GELFrEE fractions
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2msda","text":"Very slowly add 3 volumes (450 µL) of Optima methanol to the tube, to avoid breaking up the protein pellet more than is necessary. Slowly mix the solution by carefully rocking the tube back and forth three to five times, while keeping an eye on the protein pellet and being careful to break it up as little as possible. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Desalting and concentrating GELFrEE fractions
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"f2u8b","text":"Centrifuge the tubes at 21,000g for 10 min at 4 °C","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Desalting and concentrating GELFrEE fractions
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fj060","text":"At this point, the protein pellet should now be at the bottom of the tube. Carefully remove and discard as much methanol as possible from the tube without disturbing the pellet, and repeat steps 32–34 two more times. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Desalting and concentrating GELFrEE fractions
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6mbha","text":"After the final methanol wash, remove as much methanol as possible from the tube without accidentally removing protein pellet particles. Place open tubes in a tube rack in an operating biological safety cabinet for 5–10 min to evaporate off any excess methanol. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Desalting and concentrating GELFrEE fractions
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"861q2","text":"If sample is to be analyzed by CZE-MS/MS, pellet is resuspended in 10 uL 0.3% acetic acid. If sample is to be analyzed by LC-MS/MS, pellet is resuspended in 25 uL of buffer A (5% acetonitrile, 94.8% water, 0.2% formic acid).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Desalting and concentrating GELFrEE fractions
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4s0sn","text":"Centrifuge the samples at 21,000g for 5 min at 4 °C, and slowly remove the majority of the solution, pipetting from just below the surface to avoid disturbing any unnoticed particles. Transfer each sample to a separate, pre-chilled LC vial. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Desalting and concentrating GELFrEE fractions
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9v9kf","text":"Transport the vials on ice to the nano-UHPLC auto sampler and analyze immediately to prevent sample degradation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Cell lysis, protein precipitation, and lysate quantitation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2i6s9","text":"Sonicate lysate with a probe sonicator on ice (40% power, cycle 2 sec on, 3 sec off, 30 sec total).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6njdn","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"f557h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"equipment","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":3120,"brand":"Fisherbrand","can_edit":0,"guid":"457732B098F211ECAE52ABFCAF4CDDC0","link":"https://www.fishersci.com/shop/products/fisher-scientific-model-120-sonic-dismembrator-4/p-3974654","name":"Fisherbrand Model 120 Sonic Dismembrator","sku":"FB120110","specifications":"Equipped with 1/8\" probe","type":"Sonicator","vendor":{"id":31,"name":"Fisher Scientific","link":"https://www.fishersci.com/us/en/home.html","image":{"source":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png","placeholder":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png"}},"file":null,"image":null}}}}

steps.section: Cell lysis, protein precipitation, and lysate quantitation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"99h3k","text":"Transfer lysate to 1.5 mL Lo-bind Eppendorf tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9fhif","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1dg68","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":180213,"mol_weight":0,"name":"Protein LoBind Tubes, 1.5 mL","linfor":"","url":"https://online-shop.eppendorf.com/OC-en/Laboratory-Consumables-44512/Tubes-44515/Protein-LoBind-Tubes-PF-56251.html","sku":"0030108116","cas_number":"","rrid":"","public":1,"can_edit":0,"guid":"F2B59A4098F511ECAE52ABFCAF4CDDC0","in_steps":null,"vendor":{"id":214,"name":"Eppendorf","link":"https://www.eppendorf.com","image":{"source":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png","placeholder":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png"}}}}}}

steps.section: Cell lysis, protein precipitation, and lysate quantitation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7ao75","text":"Fill liquid nitrogen dewar and equilibrate to 1.3 bar","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Cell lysis, protein precipitation, and lysate quantitation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"vgv0","text":"Add frozen tissue sample to 25 mL grinding jar containing a 1-inch stainless steel ball.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Cell lysis, protein precipitation, and lysate quantitation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"66meo","text":"Pulverize with three cycles of precooling with liquid nitrogen at 1 Hz for 3 min and grinding at 30 Hz for 1 min","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
